intro: [WRONG START] Hieracesium leucophaeum subsp. nematopodum, commonly known as the pale-leaved hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its yellow flowers and basal rosette of leaves. The subspecies is distinguished by its pale green leaves and shorter flower stems compared to other members of the species. It typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as grasslands and meadows. The plant has a taproot system and produces seeds that are dispersed by wind.
